page.title: 12Micklepage
page.content: Micklepage farm is a seventeenth century{farmhouse}which is owned by the{Anglican Community of St Hilda. The trustees allow groups to come and live at the centre to experience a Christian way of communal life. Groups come mainly from{London,}especially the University. There are two barns: one, very old is used as a simple chapel and the other{New Barn}has been converted into a common room, bedrooms and living areas. Fourteen guests can stay at both the old farmhouse and the New Barn. These facilities are used by local groups as well. The Rector held confirmation classes here and the local deanery clergy meeting have also met there. The local{School}used the Chapel and grounds during their annual Ascension Day walk. The job creation scheme has been involved in renovating the property.
